page.title: 02BLOCK PREFACE (2)
page.content:
The major social concern for most of the area is the imminent extention of the{M20 Motor-way}which, whilst the line has not been announced it is accepted by the locals, as running from it's existing end in square 00 44 along the N.E. side and within 150 metres of the railway line then turn east under the railway at Tutt Hill, where a bridge to carry the railway is at present under construction. The motor-way will then cross the{A20}and swing N.W. passing to the west of Charing.
During interviews with local people most said they favoured the motor-way, including a farmer who is losing some fourty acres of land, because "it will make the A20 a safer road".
{More about the block on page 3.
